content:
This thread was created to continue a long discussion that has been documented in email. The attached file holds the prior discussion. It exceeds the length allowed in zulip for a post, so you need to review the file from the bottom up if you want to review the prior discussion about how to address the need to represent problems that require more than one SNOMED CT or more than one ICD-10 code to represent the issue.

Multi-code-Problem.docx
Yes, thanks for moving the discussion here, @Lisa Nelson

Reminder to anyone interested to indicate their availability to discuss this here: https://doodle.com/poll/fdeur5ftav4i9sx2

I'll take a look at the results and send out an invite for a call so we can come up with a plan for this prior to discussing it at the WGM.

@Matt Szczepankiewicz Just got back on zulip and filled out the doodle. I noticed that many of the times are not too friendly for @Michael Lawley and it would be really helpful for him to attend. Perhaps he can give us some times here that are early in his "next day" that line up with late in the day in the US and we re-send the doodle by tagging folks here to re-assess?
Yeah, later in the day in the US (ie next day morning in Australia) would work too--I just didn't realize we'd have anyone on the call from outside the US. Added more time slots to reflect that!

Hey all--please indicate your availability on the Doodle poll (https://doodle.com/poll/fdeur5ftav4i9sx2) if you haven't already (and note that I added evening timeslots on all the available days to make it easier for @Michael Lawley to attend). I'll send out a meeting invite based on people's availability sometime later this week.

I didn't have the invite (probably because I didn't fill out the poll), but I was reminded and glad to join the call today. Was this call the only one planned (so far)?
@Matt Szczepankiewicz
Yep, as I mentioned, the point of today's call was to figure out what recommendations we wanted to put forward at the WGM, so we'll be talking about this again there in two weeks!
